{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3481968,"name":"Jake","username":"_j_kot","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/_j_kot/{size}/242255_2.png","created_at":"2025-01-14T13:35:17.995Z","cooked":"

Hello,

We are facing issues with spark max controllers, it is not showing up in our rev hardware. It does when I initially plug them in, but they‚Äôre software is 1.xx initially so I update it and when I do, it stops being recognized. Rolling back to 1.xx does not make it discoverable. It also says that no drivers were found. Any ideas recommendations?

image1920√ó1031 87.5 KB

Thank u for ur help and ideas!

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":7,"updated_at":"2025-01-14T13:50:50.616Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":235,"reads":129,"readers_count":128,"score":1200.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":481639,"topic_slug":"spark-max-driver-not-installed","display_username":"Jake","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":2,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":70713,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Coding Lead"},"post_url":"/t/spark-max-driver-not-installed/481639/1","custom_user_title":"Coding Lead","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true,"can_vote":false},{"id":3482938,"name":"Jake","username":"_j_kot","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/_j_kot/{size}/242255_2.png","created_at":"2025-01-15T01:48:06.982Z","cooked":"

Here is a solution for everyone from REV dirrectly:

  1. Download ClearSparkUsbState.zip and extract the file after downloading completes.
  • **Note this link is an automatic download

  1. Open the extracted folder, and double-click ClearSparkUsbState.cmd to run the fix

  1. Grant the script admin privileges when it prompts.
  • If Windows displays a warning, click more info, and then click ‚ÄúRun Anyway‚Äù

  1. The cmd window will stay open for a very short period of time, this is expected.

  2. Once the cmd window has closed, use recovery mode to install SPARK MAX firmware version 24.0.1 onto ONE (1) SPARK MAX.

  1. The SPARK MAX should appear in the Client after a few moments. If it does not appear after the firmware installation has finished, power cycle it by disconnecting then reconnecting the USB.

  1. Upgrade to firmware 25.0.1.

All SPARK MAXs should be able to be seen by the Client after this process and can be safely updated to 25.0.1.

We tried the instructions several times on two different Spark MAXes, but after updating in recovery mode, it still would not show up in the REV Hardware Client. Any other advice?

We tried the REV Hardware Client on a new computer, and it worked.

That was the official response from VEX, but otherwise no. Worked for two computers I tried on. They also said they are working on a permanent fix.

This will only work if drivers are the issue, to check that you need to go into device manager and verify that Spark Max shows up like on screenshot:

REV_Hardware_Client_ccZVPws9kR846√ó874 55.6 KB

Otherwise, this is not the solution to your problem and you should not try that method.

I have this problem on one of the team‚Äôs laptops ‚Äì the exact issue shown above in Device Manager. The issue is, Windows is pretty hostile toward the download itself ‚Äì claims it‚Äôs a virus.

Chrome and Edge won‚Äôt touch the link. They both abort the download with no option to override. Firefox will download it, but the resulting zip can‚Äôt be opened or extracted, even after overriding the ‚Äúthis file came from another computer‚Äù box in explorer properties.

The file also seems to get auto-deleted after a minute or so anyway.

Any thoughts?

Yes, and that is an expected behavior as it messes with drivers and runs on a pretty low level.

I would just disable antivirus and force install, or make like a trusted folder and download it there so antivirus wouldn‚Äôt check it.

If that does not help then just reach out to REV, I bet they would help.
